original_solution_mapping.L1: Of the under-30s there for the second band, 40% are men because 100-60 = <<100-60=40>>40
original_solution_mapping.L2: There are fifty under-30s there for the second band because 20 / .4 = <<20/.4=50>>50
original_solution_mapping.L3: There are 100 people there to see the second band because 50 / .5 = <<50/.5=100>>100
original_solution_mapping.L4: There are 150 people at the concert because 100 / (2/3) = <<100/(2/3)=150>>150

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3255.
    Returns: the total number of people at the concert.
    """
    # L1
    total_percentage = 100 # WK
    women_percentage = 60 # 60% are women
    men_percentage = total_percentage - women_percentage

    # L2
    num_men = 20 # there are 20 men
    percent_to_decimal_divisor = 100 # WK
    men_percentage_decimal = men_percentage / percent_to_decimal_divisor
    under_30_second_band_total = num_men / men_percentage_decimal

    # L3
    under_30_percent_second_band = 50 # 50% of the audience there for the second band is under the age of 30
    under_30_percent_second_band_decimal = under_30_percent_second_band / percent_to_decimal_divisor
    second_band_audience_total = under_30_second_band_total / under_30_percent_second_band_decimal

    # L4
    second_band_fraction = Fraction(2, 3) # 2/3 of the audience was there for the second band
    total_concert_people = second_band_audience_total / second_band_fraction

    # FA
    answer = total_concert_people
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Of the under-30s there for the second band, 40% are men because {total_percentage}-{women_percentage}=<<{total_percentage}-{women_percentage}={men_percentage}>>{men_percentage}
There are fifty under-30s there for the second band because {num_men} / {men_percentage_decimal} = <<{num_men}/{men_percentage_decimal}={under_30_second_band_total}>>{under_30_second_band_total}

There are 100 people there to see the second band because {under_30_second_band_total} / {under_30_percent_second_band_decimal} = <<{under_30_second_band_total}/{under_30_percent_second_band_decimal}={second_band_audience_total}>>{second_band_audience_total}

There are 150 people at the concert because {second_band_audience_total} / ({second_band_fraction}) = <<{second_band_audience_total}/({second_band_fraction})={total_concert_people}>>{total_concert_people}

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'percent_to_decimal_divisor' (100) was used instead of 'num_men' (20).
